feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Continue on the Tanana River... The Tanana River continues to run near bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to remain high through the week. Expect many gravel bars to remain underwater, with increased debris moving downriver.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...More Rain in the Alaska Range... Another moisture laden weather system is moving across the Interior and Alaska Range with rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 1.5 inch expected through Wednesday morning. Rain is expect to continue through most of the coming week. Heaviest rainfall will be south of Kantishna and Healy in Denali
entry.cap:areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range
